entry.title: Keage Incline・蹴上インクライン

link.title: Keage Incline・蹴上インクライン

entry.content:
Cherry blossoms at Keage Incline, part of the Lake Biwa Canal system. Planted with cherry trees, the now-abandoned train track is a popular photo location.

125 years ago, the flowing water generated enough hydro electricity to power Kyoto’s first streetcar system. The canal still supplies Kyoto with water from Japan’s largest freshwater lake.

entry.title: Flower Blizzard・花吹雪
entry.content:
Winds blow cherry blossoms off the trees, creating a flower blizzard and a carpet of blossoms on the ground.

On the Philosophers Walk (哲学の道), a river path lined with cherry trees in eastern Kyoto.
